name: "Colonel Danning", X-Cellent Hero
effect: Each time "Colonel Danning" earns a different glyph the next mission this turn gets difficulty -1.
Lead character of the science fiction TV series "Wormhole X-treme!"

name: "DrLevant", X-Cellent Hero
effect: At the end of your power phase gain 1 power for each different glyph "Dr. Levant" has.
Major character on the science fiction TV series "Wormhole X-treme!"

name: "Grell", X-Cellent Hero
effect: [S] : Complications cost power +1 to play while "Grell" is assigned. [T] : Complications cost power +1 to play while "Grell" is assigned.
Taciturn character on the science fiction TV series "Wormhole X-treme!"

name: "Major Monroe", X-Cellent Hero
effect: [O] Stop and incapacitate "Major Monroe" -- Destroy all obstacles at the current mission.
Major character on the science fiction TV series "Wormhole X-treme!" "The positronic field emitters are offline but I can compensate by generating a feedback loop."

name: A Matter of Trust
effect: Failure: Stop a character.
I believe Daniel Jackson speaks the truth.

name: Accompany Documentary Crew
effect: Each assigned team character who has a glyph gets CUL +1.
Escort a film crew producing a documentary on the Stargate program for future historians when its existence is ultimately made public.

name: Adam Banks, Gunner
effect: Success: Destroy a villain ship.
F-302 pilot who shared a cockpit with Cameron Mitchell during the battle against Anubis over Antarctica.

name: Adaption
effect: Failure: For each other Replicator card at the current mission destroy a gear.
I wanted to thank you. You gave me the opportunity to study the disruptor and that allowed me to make myself immune to its effects.

name: Aden Corso, Convicted Criminal
effect: Failure: You may play a villian ship at no cost.
Leader of the small group of criminals that seized control of the prison ship Seberus and held the ship from its rightful crew for years.

name: Adria's Mothership, Light of Origin
effect: Victory: You may pay 3 power. If you do blockade a mission. Failure: Destroy a support character for each blockaded mission.
Spreads truth throughout the galaxy.

name: Adria, Leader of Great Enlightenment
effect: Each time you assign Adria ready an assigned character. He is blocked from the current mission.

'We thwarted all efforts against us. Crippled your feet. Met with little if any resistance on the worlds that we redeemed. Opposition to the Ori is clearly hopeless but you continue to struggle against the inevitable.''

name: Adria, The Orici
effect: Failure: Destroy a support character for each complication.

Ori who descended to human form retaining the knowledge and powers of her kind. She became a mighty figurehead inspiring or coercing world after world to convert to Origin as she led an army across the galaxy.

name: Aid Evacuation
effect: Each obstacle costs power -1 to play for each trait (other than obstacle) it shares with a villain card at the current mission.
Assist the Tok'ra in holding off a Goa'uld attack until their people can be relocated to a new base.

name: Aid Resistance
effect: This mission gets difficulty -1 for each successful mission this turn.
Establish an alliance with the Jaffa warrior women of this world and persuade them to begin using the drug tretonin in lieu of relying on Goa'uld symbiotes.

name: Al'kesh Bomber
effect: Each time you assign this ship, you may choose a glyph on an assigned character and pay power equal to its experience. If you do, your opponent may choose to pay the same amount of power. If he doesn't, he puts that glyph on the bottom of his mission pile.
Heavily armed for its size this type of ship is often used to put down slave rebellions.

name: Alliance in Jeopardy
effect: Failure: Stop a number of characters equal to the experience of the current mission.
Your use of this Ancient device violates our prior agreement.

name: Ambushed Summit
effect: Failure: Destroy any number of support characters whose total cost is equal to or less than the experience of the current mission.
Once discovered by Moloc the warriors of the Hak'tyl resistance came under swift and merciless attack.

name: Anti-Replicator Disruptor
effect: Stop this gear -- Reveal a random card from your opponent's hand. If it's a Replicator card he discards it. Destroy this gear pay 2 power -- Destroy a Replicator obstacle or assigned Replicator adversary.
Who's your daddy?!

name: Anubis' Mothership, Seat of Power
effect: Each time you assign Anubis' Mothership you may pay 1 power. If you do search your deck for a Goa'uld card reveal it take it into hand and shuffle your deck.
Anubis traveled the galaxy on this ship searching for the Goa'uld crystals known as 'the Eyes' so he could assemble a weapon of mass destruction.

name: Anubis, Warlord
effect: Each of your ships gets firepower +1 for each blockaded mission. Failure: You may pay 2 power. If you do blockade a mission.
With a wave of my hand I will bombard the surface.

name: Apophis' Ha'tak, The Serpent's Tooth
effect: Apophis' Ha'tak gets firepower +X where X is equal to the experience of the current mission. Victory: Your opponent may stop two characters. If he doesn't you may stop a character.
Flagship commanded by Apophis in his assault on Earth.

name: Apophis' Mothership, The Serpent's Venom
effect: While Apophis' Mothership is assigned Goa'uld obstacles and Jaffa obstacles get difficulty +1.
When Apophis overthrew Sokar he gained control of his fallen rival's vast resources. With them he built the largest and most powerful ship to be commanded by a System Lord.

name: Apophis, Risen from the Fires
effect: Each time you assign Apophis you may take a villain ship card from your discard pile into hand.
As Apophis seized control of first Sokar's forces then Heru'ur's the armada of ships at his disposal swelled to frightening numbers.

name: Appropriation Committee Meeting
effect: Success: Gain 1 power for each character who has a glyph.
Argue before a Senate subcommittee against a drastic reduction in the operating budget of the SGC.

name: Archaic Death Glider
effect: Each time you assign this ship you may pay 3 power. If you do block an adversary from the current mission.
There is an old Jaffa saying General Hammond: they do not build them as they once did.

name: Archaic Tel'tak
effect: Each time you assign this ship you may pay 2 power. If you do ready or unblock an adversary.

The design of the Goa'uld Tel'tak has seen some changes over the centuries. A few of the old ships are still operable including one hidden by Osiris in the desert near Cairo before he was imprisoned by Seth.

name: Arlos, Alien Technology Expert
effect: Each time you play a gear you may stop Arlos. If you do gain 1 power.
Lovesick research scientist once conned by Vala Mal Doran. He is a leading authority on his planet familiar with most every conceivable form of alien technology.

name: Aschen Harvester
effect: Victory: Gain 1 power for each blockaded mission. Failure: You may pay 2 power. If you do blockade a mission.
This advanced ship is used to transport goods between planets under Aschen control.

name: Attend Jaffa Summit
effect: Adversaries are blocked while all assigned characters are team characters.
Meet covertly with the Jaffa leadership to discuss options against the Ori. Take care not to attract unwanted attention from the enemy.

name: Baal's Ha'tak, Mighty Warship
effect: Victory: You may pay 3 power. If you do blockade a mission. Failure: Stop a character for each blockaded mission.
When Baal rose to power after centuries in the shadows he reveled in its rewards.

name: Barroom Thugs
effect: This obstacle costs power -X to play where X is equal to the experience of the current mission.
Well it's natural for small town people to be suspicious of strangers right? We just have to give it more of an effort. "You have much to learn about humans."

name: Battered Defenses
effect: When you play this obstacle stop a support character for each card in your villain score pile.
Sokar is firing some sort of particle beam at the barrier we've placed within our Stargate. How do we defend against it? "There is no defense."

name: Beliskner, Thor's Chariot
effect: Victory: Place a promotion token on a team character. Success: If a character who has a promotion token is assigned you may destroy an adversary.
Flagship of Supreme Commande Thor. With it he removed the Goa'uld from Cimmeria.

name: Birra, Citizen of Kallana
effect: Birra gets CUL+1 for each ING obstacle at the current mission. Birra gets ING +1 for each CUL obstacle at the current mission.
Free Jaffa living on Kallana. Though she was no more willing than her brethren to bow down in worship of the Ori she was more concerned about the threat posed by the Prior who had visited them.

name: Bo'rel, Free Jaffa
effect: Each other Jaffa character who has at least one glyph matching one of Bo'rel's gets skills +1.

Jaffa warrior formerly in the service of Cronus. He pledged his loyalty to Se'tak after his people's liberation. As a trusted lieutenant of the new leader he was often sent on offworld missions to secure technology and resources.

name: Bra'tac, Honored Teacher
effect: Each time Bra'tac earns a different glyph you may pay 2 power. If you do ready or stop another Jaffa card.
Not bad for a man of a hundred and thirty-three.

name: Brooks, Computer Tech
effect: Brooks costs power -2 to play if there was a successful mission this turn.
Engineering specialist working for the Trust. She hacked into the computer of Osiris' abandoned ship though she required the help of a translation coerced from Daniel Jackson.

name: Calibrate Super-Weapon
effect: If there have been no successful missions this turn this mission gets difficulty +2.
Hurry to reconfigure an Ancient large-scale weapon so it can be used in a battle already in progress without killing allies in the target area.

name: Cameron Mitchell, "MrShaft"
effect: Each time you assign Cameron Mitchell you may look at two cards from the top of your opponent's deck for each different glyph he has. Place them in any order on the top and/or bottom of that deck.
To learn more about the Lucian Alliance plot to distribute an addictive food crop Cameron Mitchell posed as a potential buyer.

name: Cameron Mitchell, Blue Leader
effect: Stop Cameron Mitchell pay 2 power -- Ready a hero ship.
As leader of the F-302 squadron that defended Anubis' attack on Earth Cameron Mitchell bought SG-1 the time needed to activate the Ancient weapon in Antarctica.

name: Capture Clone
effect: When you play this mission you may pay 3 power. If you do choose an adversary. He is blocked.
Using intelligence provided by Baal apprehend one of his clones.

name: Cheap Knockoff
effect: To play this event pay power equal to double the cost of an obstacle. Destroy that obstacle.
With their sophisticated technology the Tok'ra can not only extend their resources but also their own naturally long life spans.

name: Chekov, Korolev Commander
effect: Each time Chekov earns a [L] or [T] glyph you may search your deck for a hero ship card. If you do reveal it take it into hand and shuffle your deck.
Colonel Chekov wielded considerable political clout to force the SGC to give Russia its own interstellar spaceship. He then commanded the vessel himself on her maiden voyage.

name: Cicero, Archaeological Researcher
effect: When you play Cicero you may pay X power. If you do stop him and destroy an obstacle that costs X.
Researcher at an historical museum on P4M-328 and first of his people to deduce the Stargate's true purpose. When SG-1 arrived on his world proving his theories he was quite eager to assist them.

name: Cloak Earth
effect: This mission gets difficulty -1 while at least one character who has a [L] glyph is assigned.
Help adapt Ancient cloaking technology to defend the Earth of an alternate reality from a full-force Ori attack.

name: Clues from the Past
effect: Failure: The next mission this turn gets difficulty +1.
This parchment was purportedly left behind by Morgan herself as a guide for knights of noble spirit since it is said that only the most virtuous will succeed in claiming the Sangraal.

name: Conservation
effect: This event costs power -1 to play for each Tok'ra character who has a glyph. Take a hero card from your discard pile into hand.
With their sophisticated technology the Tok'ra can not only extend their resources but also their own naturally long life spans.

name: Consult Expert
effect: Failure: Your opponent stops a character.
Seek out an expert on alien technology and secure his help in dealing with the unexpected side effects of a Goa'uld device.

name: Coordinated Assault
effect: Success: Look at the top four cards of your opponent's deck. You may place them in any order on the top and/or bottom of that deck.
Conduct simultaneous raids on a number of suspected hideouts for the Trust.

name: Cornered
effect: When you play this obstacle your opponent stops a character for each other Replicator card at the current mission.
It will be far less painful if you don't resist.

name: Corrupted Ally
effect: Failure: Destroy a support character. Then if your opponent has more support characters than team characters destroy another support character.

Like you my judgment was clouded by suspicion and distrust. But the Ori sensed my misgivings forgave me my weaknesses and showed me their power. I stand before you today as proof of their divine might.

name: Covert Strike
effect: To play this event stop any number of team characters. Destroy an obstacle with a cost equal to that number of characters.
Often outnumbered by Jaffa soldiers SG teams must at times seek a more clever solution to a problem.

name: Cure Deadly Virus
effect: Success: You may ready an assigned character.
Explore a network of caves in search of a cure for a lethal airborne virus before you succumb to its sleep effects.

name: Daniel Jackson, Ambassador of Earth
effect: [O] and [O] : Support characters cost power -1 to play. [P] and [P] : Support characters cost power -1 to play. [T] and [T] : Support characters cost power -1 to play.
With his gift for languages and diplomacy Daniel Jackson was often the key to befriending the natives of alien worlds.

name: Daniel Jackson, Prior of the Ori
effect: Success: Destroy all assigned adversaries. During your opponent's turn Daniel Jackson becomes an Ori adversary with revive cost 5. He can't be scored.
Daniel was transformed by Adria after winning her trust. This gave him the means to attack the Ori though he had to preach as a Prior to allay suspicion until SG-1 captured him.

name: Dave Dixon, SG-3 Commander
effect: To assign an adversary while Dave Dixon is assigned your opponent pays 1 power for each glyph he has.
Leader of SG-13 a duty he considers almost serene compared to the challenge of raising four kids. He maintains a casual rapport with his team.

name: Death Glider
effect: Victory: You may pay X power. If you do destroy an assigned support character that costs X.
These nimble fighters have been a ubiquitous threat since the very first explorers from Earth set foot on Abydos.

name: Debilitated
effect: Failure: Place this obstacle on a team character. He is blocked and his owner may perform this action: "Pay power equal to the experience of the current mission -- Destroy this obstacle."
No matter how strong and determined the patient some injuries and diseases are healed only by time and great effort.

name: Destroy Kassa Shipment
effect: Success: Destroy a villain ship.
Plant explosives aboard this freighter to halt delivery of the addictive crop.

name: Destroy Weapon
effect: Success: Each team character gets skills +1 until the end of the turn.
Use any means necessary to destroy the energy weapon designed by Anubis to detonate the naquadah inside a targeted Stargate.

name: Devon, Trust Operative
effect: Each time you assign Devon you may discard a card. If you do draw a card.
Agent for the Trust who served as personal aide to Athena. He abducted Vala Mal Doran so her memories could be probed.

name: Diplomatic Envoy
effect: When you play this mission you may pay 2 power. If you do ready a support character.
Forestall efforts by members of the Trust to disrupt peaceful relations between the United States and Russia.

name: Direct Hit
effect: When you play this obstacle, you may choose one: stop a hero ship; or destroy a stopped hero ship.
Mayday! Mayday! We are going in! Repeat: we are going in!

name: Disable Orbital Weapon
effect: Failure: Your opponent may pay power equal to an adversary's cost. If he does he scores that adversary.
Persuade the Rand leader to reject aid from the Ori.

name: Discredit Link
effect: Failure: Obstacles costs power -1 to play until the end of the turn.
Make an appearance on a national news program to undermine the credibility of a businessman who recently exposed a major government secret to the public.

name: Dr Jackson spy for apophis
effect: Each time you assign Dr. Jackson gain 1 power for each glyph on the assigned character who has the most glyphs. When you score Dr. Jackson incapacitate an SGC team character.
In an alternate reality Daniel Jackson was secretly implanted with a symbiote then returned to his team to work undercover.

name: Dutiful Prior, Adria's Attendant
effect: While this adversary card is in your villain score pile obstacles that have failure text cost power -1 to play.
Prior who works closely with the Orici. He was present at her birth and accompanied her to many planets in search of the Sangraal.

name: Elizabeth Weir, Ancient Languages Expert
effect: Success: Look at one card from the top of your mission pile for each glyph on each assigned character. Place one of those cards on the top of that pile and the rest on the bottom in any order.
During SG-1's visit to Atlantis Dr. Weir assisted Daniel Jackson in his search for the location of the Sangraal. rights!"

name: Emmett Bregman, Documentary Filmmaker
effect: Emmett Bregman costs power -1 to play for each assigned character who has a glyph.
Film journalist invited inside Cheyenne Mountain by the U.S. President who had decided that after nearly seven years of operations it was time someone documented the SGC for future generations.

name: Enlightened Prior, Teacher of Origin
effect: When you score Enlightened Prior you may play an adversary at no cost.
I have come to spread the word to the unbelievers who have been sheltered and raised by evil.

name: Eradicate Computer Virus
effect: Failure: You can't play any more missions this turn.
Expunge a program from the Stargate network that is preventing outgoing wormholes from being established.

name: Erin Gant, Bridge Officer
effect: Victory: Gain 1 power for each different glyph Erin Gant has.
Officer aboard the Prometheus under William Ronson's command. She participated in the ship's early tests of a naquadria-fueled hyperdrive.

name: Escape the Pressure
effect: To assign a character pay 1 power for each glyph he has.
Attend a mandatory retreat at Jack O'Neill's mountain cabin.

name: Escape Time Dilation Field
effect: Failure: Your opponent may place this mission on top of your mission pile.
Find a way to deactivate the field protecting the Odyssey without losing the ship in an Ori attack.

name: Escort IOA Representatives
effect: Each time your opponent plays a complication stop a character.
It'll be IOA's first time off world. The President wants to make sure it goes off without a hitch. He figures who better to ensure that than our top team? --Hank Landry

name: Execution Squad
effect: Failure: You may pay 2 power. If you do destroy a support character.
There is only one way to deal with those who refuse to embrace Origin.

name: Exonerate Team Member
effect: This mission gets difficulty -1 while an assigned character has at least two glyphs.
Use the Galaran memory device to clear one of your team of murder charges.

name: Exploitation
effect: Success or Failure: You may force the hero player to continue to another mission this turn. If you do he pays no power to continue though you still gain 1 power for each failed mission.
After aiding the people of an alternate reality and becoming a celebrity in the process Samantha Carter was strong-armed into publicity supporting the fascist government.

name: Explore Ruins
effect: Success: Choose up to four cards from your discard pile and shuffle them into your deck.
Conduct research on Goa'uld technology found in this abandoned location.

name: Extract Prisoners
effect: Failure: Incapacitate a team character.
Rescue SGC personnel taken prisoner by Honduran terrorists.

name: F-302
effect: Each time you assign this ship you may pay 3 power. If you do turn a COM obstacle at the current mission face down. (It becomes a complication.)
The first successful fighter capable of space flight to be designed by the U.S. military. It was built using knowledge taken from Jaffa death gliders and the failed X-301 project.

name: Fannis, Ancestral Investigator
effect: Destroy Fannis -- Choose a team character to get skills +1 until the end of the turn.

Villager of Ver Ager and member of the underground resistance working against the worship of the Ori. He seeks out and hides artifacts of the distant past a practice deemed sacrilegious by the Book of Origin.

name: Fend Off
effect: Choose one: stop a villain ship
Surface-to-air missiles have been in use for decades but the SGC has employed them against targets their inventors could never have imagined.

name: Final Challenge
effect: When you play this obstacle your opponent may stop a team character. If he doesn't you may destroy a support character.

Isolated worshipers of Apophis continued to train in simulated wargames after his death. When SG-1 arrived at one such training camp the training escalated to its final stage: the use of real weapons.

name: First, Leap in Evolution
effect: First costs power +1 to play for each assigned character. While First is assigned each of your Replicator obstacles gets dominion
The first Human-form Replicator to emerge in the Milky Way and a ruthless leader.

name: Francis Maynard, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs
effect: Victory: The next mission this turn gets difficulty -1.

Top general serving as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. He informed incoming President Henry Hayes of the existence of the Stargate program and counseled him during a climactic confrontation with Anubis.

name: Free Jaffa Ha'tak
effect: This ship gets firepower +1 for each assigned Jaffa character who has a glyph. Victory: You may pay 2 power. If you do search your deck for a Jaffa hero card reveal it take it into hand and shuffle your deck.
When the Goa'uld were defeated the System Lords' ships came under Jaffa command.

name: Free Unas
effect: When you play this mission your opponent chooses a support character. He is stopped. Failure: Destroy the chosen character.
Release several Unas prisoners soon to be sold into slavery.

name: Friends at Odds
effect: When you play this obstacle choose an assigned team character. Team characters who don't have all his traits are blocked.
I will avenge the deaths of the Jaffa at Dar Eshkalon. Arkad must die no matter what the consequences. I do not wish to harm any of you but if you try to stop me I will.

name: Gadmeer Ship, Legacy of a Civilization
effect: Failure: Look at the top card of your opponent's mission pile. Place it on the top or bottom of that pile.
This computer-controlled "ark" searches the galaxy for a planet on which to recreate life from the homeworld of its long-extinct creators.

name: Genetic Manipulations
effect: Failure: Your opponent incapacitates a team character for each card in your villain score pile.
Once you have seen what has already happened to the others perhaps you will change your mind.

name: Goa'uld Ha'tak
effect: Each Goa'uld card in your villain score pile gets cost +1. Failure: Destroy a stopped hero ship.
Over time the Goa'uld warship has incorporated a secondary superstructure. The core pyramid design however has stayed the same for millennia.

name: Goa'uld Probe
effect: Failure: The next mission this turn gets difficulty +1.
Inspired perhaps by the MALPs used by the SGC the Goa'uld began to use robotic probes for reconnaissance of worlds outside their control.

name: Government Oversight
effect: This obstacle costs power -X to play where X is equal to the experience of the current mission.

Though the International Oversight Advisory tends not to interfere with daily Stargate operations they always take notice when the stakes of a mission are particularly high. Their demands are often at odds with the recommendations of SGC personnel.

name: Greed Exploited
effect: This obstacle's difficulty is equal to the experience of the current mission.
Morgan le Fay created a series of tests for those who came in search of the Sangraal. One was a force field designed to entrap any victim blinded by greed.

name: Hadden, SG- Commander
effect: Hadden gets ING +1 for each different glyph he has.
Leader of SG-12. He and his team once accompanied Teal'C on a mission to the Sodan homeworld of P9G-844 at a time when the rest of SG-1 was unavailable.

name: Halt Subterranean Reaction
effect: When you play this mission you may discard any number of cards. For every four you discard this mission gets difficulty -1.
Use Kelownan resources to keep a chain reaction in the underground naquadria from destroying the planet.

name: Harold Maybourne, Helpful Informant
effect: [G] Stop Harold Maybourne -- All other Russian team characters and NID team characters get skills +1 until the end of the current mission. [O] : Each other Russian or NID character who has a [O] glyph gets skills +1 character +1.
After falling out of favor with the NID Maybourne helped the Russians get their fledgling gate program off the ground.

name: Harsh Justice
effect: This event costs power -1 to play for each Jaffa character who has a glyph. Destroy an adversary.
...I have implanted an explosive device within your symbiote pouch. It is set to detonate within a matter of moments.

name: Hathor's Interrogation
effect: When you play this obstacle you may take a villain card from your discard pile and place it on top of your deck.

After her long imprisonment Hathor's power base had eroded and her knowledge of current events throughout the galaxy was even weaker. She probed the minds of SG-1 in an effort to bring herself up to date.

name: Heru'ur, Shrewd Rival
effect: While Heru'ur is assigned the failure text of each villain card occurs an additional time.
Child of Ra and Hathor and a System Lord of some power in his own right. He has been a long time nemesis of Apophis always seeking out hidden weaknesses to exploit.

name: Hide the Harcesis
effect: Failure: Your opponent may search his deck for a villain card. If he does he reveals it takes it into hand and shuffles his deck.
Hide the newborn child of Apophis and Amonet from the competing Goa'uld attempting to capture it.

name: Hok'taur Experiments
effect: Failure: Destroy a support character for each card in your villain score pile.

Most of Nirrti's genetic experiments were attempts to create a hok'taur slave an advanced human with powerful mental abilities. Unlocking such abilities proved less difficult than keeping a test subject alive afterward.

name: Hoskins, Agent of the Trust
effect: [G] or [O] Destroy a support character -- Destroy an obstacle at the current mission that costs less than that character. You can do this only once each turn.
Field operative who oversaw the capture of Osiris' abandoned ship and its subsequent use in launching chemical attacks on Goa'uld planets.

name: HUD Headset
effect: While a Tok'ra character is assigned you get total firepower +1 in each ship battle. While a Jaffa character is assigned you get total firepower +1 in each ship battle.
This supplemental instrument readout used primarily in controlling Tel'tak vessels increases the number of ship's systems that a single pilot can effectively monitor.

name: Indulgences
effect: Discard any number of cards from your hand then draw a card.
One can never know what equipment might prove useful during a mission but there are limits to being "prepared."

name: Infiltrate Lucian Alliance
effect: When you play this mission if there have been no successful missions this turn your opponent gains 2 power.
Use the Reole chemical to go undercover in the Lucian Alliance as one of its leader's most trusted advisors.

name: Insight
effect: Place a promotion token on a team character. He gets skills +1 until the end of the current mission.
I've got it! I figured it out. The answer you were looking for to the... the... Clava The Thesaurusy thingamajigamy.

name: Interference
effect: To play this event stop and destroy an Ancient support character. Destroy an adversary who costs less than that character.
What are you going to do?

name: Investigate Farrow Marshall
effect: Obstacles that share a trait with an assigned adversary cost power -1 to play.
Determine what information a local aeronautics firm may have regarding a dead Jaffa discovered on Earth without authorization.

name: Investigate the Aschen
effect: When you play this mission your opponent may stop an adversary. If he does he gains power equal to that adversary's CUL.
Determine what secrets are being hidden by a race of potential new allies.

name: Jacek's Tel'tak, Cargo Ship
effect: Success: Discard any number of cards then draw the same number of cards.
Making the most of a deal that went south the con artist Jacek escaped with a stolen cargo ship. With it he continued to roam the galaxy seeking opportunities for quick profit.

name: Jacek, Petty Thief
effect: Jacek costs power +X to play where X is equal to the experience of the current mission.

Con artist and father to Vala though she found him deficient as both a parent and a human being in general. While at best a small time operator he can always find a way to extract a bargain from any situation.

name: Jack O'Neill, Dynamic Leader
effect: [L] or [O]: Each assigned team character gets COM +1 while Jack O'Neill is assigned. [G] and [O] : Each assigned team character gets ING +1 while Jack O' Neill is assigned.
Well I suppose now is the time for me to say something profound.... Nothing comes to mind.

name: Jack O'Neill, Jack of All Trades
effect: [G] and [G]: Missions get difficulty -1. [T] and [T]: Missions get difficulty -1.
'I can be as diplomatic and open-minded as anyone.''

name: Jacob Carter, Tok'ra Ambassador
effect: [P]: Jacob Carter gets CUL+1 and COM+1. [T]: Jacob Carter gets SCI+1 and ING+1. [P] and [T]: Jacob Carter gets SCI+1 and COM+1.
So you guys are the talk of the Tok'ra water cooler.

name: Jalen, Field Agent
effect: When you play Jalen she gets COM +2 until the end of the current mission.
Tok'ra pilot and covert operative. She once responded to a distress signal from SG-1.

name: John Sheppard, Unconventional Leader
effect: Stop John Sheppard -- Each time you play a support character this turn that character gets skills +1 until the end of the turn.
Before releasing Rodney McKay to assist SG-1 Colonel Sheppard advised Cameron Mitchell on the ways to best motivate his persnickety team member: "Shoot him... Also he's mortally allergic to citrus."

name: Jonas Quinn, Adventurer
effect: Each time you assign Jonas Quinn reveal one card from the top of your deck for each different glyph he has. He gets skills +1 until the end of the current mission for each villain card revealed. Place the cards you revealed in any order on the bottom of your deck.
I just want to be given the opportunity to prove that I can make a difference.''

name: Jonas Quinn, Quick Study
effect: Each time you assign Jonas Quinn you may pay 2 power. If you do destroy an obstacle with a cost equal to or less than the number of glyphs he has.
'Hammond is insisting SG-1 needs a sociopolitical nerd to offset our overwhelming coolness.''

name: Jonas Quinn, Special Advisor
effect: Jonas Quinn gets skills +1 for each assigned character who has a glyph.

Ethical advisor to the High Minister of Kelowna and consultant on the naquadria research project. Disappointed by his government and inspired by the heroism of Daniel Jackson he ultimately defected from his homeworld.

name: Kali, The Destroyer
effect: Kali costs power -X to play where X is equal to the experience of the current mission. Failure: Stop a character.
An ally of the System Lord Bastet the two have plotted together against many rivals Goa'uld and otherwise.

name: Kefflin, Loyal Second
effect: While Kefflin is ready ING missions get difficulty +1.

Reclusive lieutenant of Netan. He works on the outskirts of the galaxy rarely interacting with other leaders within the Lucian Alliance. The large kassa production operation he oversees is a key component of their power base.

name: Korolev, Russian Flagship
effect: Korolev gets firepower +1 for each failed mission. Each time you assign Korolev you may pay 3 power. If you do ready a Russian character or a character who has a glyph.
As a concession to renew the agreement keeping Russia's Stargate at the SGC the U.S. agreed to give up a Daedalus-class ship.

name: Liberate Labor Camp
effect: Support characters are blocked while an adversary is assigned.
Free the captured Jaffa rebels enslaved here.

name: Lie Low
effect: This mission gets difficulty -1 while two or fewer characters are assigned.
Blend in with these villagers who worship the Ori until you can find a way to return to the Milky Way galaxy.

name: Lindsey Novak, Eccentric Engineer
effect: Each time one of your ships would be incapacitated you may stop Lindsay Novak. If you do stop that ship instead.
Highly strung engineer full of strange idiosyncrasies. Though she doesn't cope well with stressful situations she is a very skilled repair technician.

name: Linea, Destroyer of Worlds
effect: CUL missions get difficulty +1. During your opponent's turn Linea becomes an adversary. She can't be revived or scored.

Brilliant scientist who worked with SG-1 to escape the prison world of Hadante. Only when it was too late did they learn the grisly scale of her crimes: she had murdered much of the population of an entire planet.

name: Lionel Pendergast, Prometheus Commander
effect: [S] Stop a hero ship -- Destroy an obstacle at the current mission whose cost is equal to or less than that ship's firepower. You can do this only once each turn.

Following the Antarctic battle with Anubis Colonel Pendergast assumed command of the Prometheus a more diplomatically minded choice for a more fractured galactic landscape. He is very protective of his crew.

name: Locate the Eye of Ra
effect: Failure: Your opponent incapacitates a team character.
Find an item Anubis seeks to complete a powerful weapon.

name: Loki, Banished Scientist
effect: [P] Stop a support character -- Choose an obstacle at the current mission that costs less than that character. Turn that obstacle face down. You can do this only once each turn.
Asgard geneticist who abducted humans for experiments and kept doing so even after being ostracized by the Ruling Council.

name: Lucian Alliance Freighter
effect: Each time you assign this ship you may choose one: pay X power and place X cards from your hand face down beneath this ship; or gain 1 power for each card beneath this ship and them place those cards in your discard pile.
These linked cargo containers are used mainly to transport the addictive crop kassa.

name: Ma'chello, Inventor
effect: When you play Ma'chello you may play a gear at no cost.
Brilliant scientist who devoted his entire life to fighting the Goa'uld through science. One of his many inventions successfully eliminated the Linvers an allied faction of minor Goa'uld.

name: Malek, Tok'ra Warrior
effect: [O] : Tok'ra support characters cost you power -1 to play. [P] : Tok'ra events Tok'ra gear and Tok'ra ships cost you power -1 to play.
After the Tok'ra base in the Risa system was overrun its former commander took a more hands-on approach in fighting the Goa'uld.

name: Marks, Bridge Officer
effect: [T] : Marks gets skills +1 while a hero ship is assigned.
Officer who has served aboard the Prometheus and the Odyssey. Reliable and always prepared he has risen quickly through the military ranks.

name: Merlin, Dissenting Ancient
effect: When you play Merlin he gets skills +2 until the end of the turn. Stop and destroy Merlin pay 3 power -- Choose a team character to get skills +2 until the end of the turn.
Hidden in stasis by Morgan le Fay Merlin was revived by SG-1. His body had deteriorated over the centuries but he had time enough to share his knowledge with the team.

name: Michael Ryan, Air Force Chief of Staff
effect: To assign Michael Ryan pay 4 power and discard a card. While Michael Ryan is assigned each assigned SGC character gets skills +1.
Thus far we like your work.

name: Might of the Orici
effect: When you play this obstacle you may pay power equal to the experience of the current mission. If you do destroy an assigned support character.
Okay! We all know darling that you have telekinetic powers. You can stop showing off now.

name: Mind Transference Device
effect: Stop this gear stop a team character pay 2 power -- Ready another character.
To prolong his life and conceal his identity from Goa'uld enemies Ma'chello created this device capable of "swapping bodies" between two people.

name: Moloc, Great and Powerful
effect: When you score Moloc choose a glyph. Your opponent puts it and all other glyphs the same character has worth the same amount of experience on the bottom of his mission pile in any order.
Goa'uld who decreed that all female Jaffa children in his domain should be executed as too weak to strengthen his armies. This led to the formation of the Hak'tyl resistance.

name: Morgan Le Fay, Dissident Ancient
effect: Each time you assign Morgan le Fay reveal the top card of your deck. If it's a hero card at the end of the current mission destroy Morgan le Fay.

Ascended Ancient who stretched the rules forbidding interference with "lowers" to direct SG-1 toward Merlin's anti-Ori weapon. Her people punished her when she went too far removing her from this plane of existence.

name: MrParker, Leader of the Trust
effect: Mr. Parker gets SCI +1 for each NID character who has a glyph.
Senior member of the Trust. Using the organization's powers he does whatever he can to protect Earth from alien attack.

name: MrWayne, Leader of the Trust
effect: Mr. Wayne gets ING +1 for each NID character who has a glyph.
Senior member of the Trust. Even after losing the resources of the legitimate NID he and his group continued operating as vigilantes against the many threats throughout the galaxy.

name: Mutated Creature
effect: When you play this obstacle for each stopped character who has a glyph your opponent destroys a support character.

The Sodan were using these devices for hundreds of years. You'd think there'd at least be a label on the side in bold print that says 'beware may cause deadly extradimensional radioactive monster-causing creature to appear.'

name: Neath, Hardened Warrior
effect: [S] : Neath gets skills +1 while another Jaffa team character is assigned. [T] : Neath gets skills +1 while a Jaffa support character is assigned.
Lieutenant of Ishta's in the Hak'tyl resistance. She was forced to kill her own father in order to save her younger sister from execution by Moloc's tyrannical decree.

name: Negotiate Mining Rights
effect: This mission gets difficulty +2 while there are more assigned support characters than assigned team characters.
Reach an accord to mine naquadah from the sacred ground of the native Unas.

name: Nerve Gas Attack
effect: This obstacle costs power -X to play where X is equal to the experience of the current mission. Failure: Destroy a support character.
I think the Trust intends to launch a full scale chemical attack against the Goa'uld without any regard for the millions of Jaffa lives that could be lost in the process.

name: Netan, Head of the Lucian Alliance
effect: Each time you pay Netan's revive cost take each card you would discard into hand instead.

The Lucian Alliance is a syndicate of smugglers and mercenaries formed in the power vacuum left by the fallen Goa'uld. Netan's leadership of them is strong and ruthless for any number of people would be quick to challenge him should anything slip throught his grasp.

name: Nice Enough Couple
effect: Choose a character. He and each other character who has at least one glyph matching one of his get skills +1 until the end of the current mission.
The longer an SG team is together the more comfortable each member becomes with how the others think. This experience proves quite handy in situations that call for quick improvisation.

name: Nothing but Weakness
effect: Failure: Incapacitate a team character. Then if a Goa'uld adversary is assigned you may take this obstacle into your hand.
Well maybe that is what happens when you abandon the strength of the Goa'uld inside of you. All that is left is this burning desire to die at the hands of your great and powerful God.

name: Obtain Information
effect: Failure: Your opponent may look at the top card of your mission pile then place it on the top or bottom of that pile.
Meet with an informant who may have valuable intel on the current operations of the Lucian Alliance.

name: Odai Ventrell, Bounty Hunter
effect: Each time your opponent plays a support character you may stop Odai Ventrell. If you do stop that support character.
Notorious mercenary employed by the Lucian Alliance among others. He is so vicious in pursuit of a bounty that he's been known to kill competing hunters that get in his way.

name: Odyssey, Deep Space Carrier
effect: Victory: You may pay 1 power. If you do each assigned character who has a glyph gets skills +1 until the end of the current mission.

Though this was the second Daedalus-class ship to be completed it was the first to be assigned primarily to missions in the Milky Way galaxy. It often provides transport and aid to SG teams in the field.

name: Orbital Bombardment
effect: This obstacle gets difficulty +1 for each assigned villain ship.
When complete annihilation is the objective there is one way to ensure success.

name: Ori Fighter
effect: Failure: You may pay 2 power. If you do blockade a mission. (Place the top card of your opponent's mission pile face up beneath this card. Return any blockaded mission it already has.)
The worshipers of the Ori seek to destroy only those who won?t accept Origin. Their powerful fighters are used more to inflict damage and intimidate than to wipe out cities.

name: Ori Ground Forces
effect: Failure: Gain power equal to the experience of the current mission.

Though the Priors command powers given by their gods they are few in number. A different kind of threat is posed by the countless worshipers of the Ori many of whom would eagerly take up arms and lay down their lives to spread the truth of Origin.

name: Ori Mothership
effect: Each time you assign this ship you may pay 2 power. If you do reveal your hand and gain 1 power for each Ori card in it. Victory: The current mission gets difficulty +1.
These mighty warships are among the most powerful the SGC has encountered.

name: Ori Satellite Attack
effect: Failure: Destroy a hero ship.
That blast cut through our shields at full strength!

name: Part of the Plan
effect: Ready an assigned adversary. He is blocked from the current mission.
You didn't really think we'd invite you to a party and not disable your funky powers did you?

name: Paul Emerson, Odyssey Commander
effect: [G] : Ships cost you power -1 to play. [S] : Ships cost you power -1 to play.
The first commander of the Odyssey. Under his effective leadership the ship moved quickly through its shakedown period and was soon fully operational.

name: Pete Shanahan, Inquisitive Detective
effect: Stop Pete Shanahan pay 4 power -- Ready another character then gain 1 power for each assigned team character who has a glyph.
Detective from Denver Colorado. He was introduced to Samantha Carter by her brother Mark. Curious about the nature of her Air Force job he discovered the true work going on at Cheyenne Mountain.

name: Prelude to Invasion
effect: When you play this obstacle for each stopped character who has a glyph your opponent stops a character.
An Ori fighter has deposited a ring platform outside the village. There are ground forces headed your way.

name: Prior Bugs
effect: To assign a support character your opponent destroys a support character.

After the SGC discovered a cure for the Prior plague the servants of the Ori changed tactics. These carnivorous insects incubate inside a human host and in a very short span of time can multiply to numbers sufficient to consume the population of an entire planet.

name: Prior Engagement
effect: When you play this obstacle you may pay power equal to the experience of the current mission. If you do stop a character.
Fire is the central icon in the religion of Origin. Those chosen to become Priors are given control over this holy force.

name: Proactive Stance
effect: This event costs power -1 to play for each NID character who has a glyph. Ready a gear.
It's very simple Colonel. Earth faces an imminent threat and we have a weapon that can eliminate that threat. We intend to use it.

name: Probing the Unconscious
effect: This obstacle costs power -X to play where X is equal to the experience of the current mission. Each character who has a glyph matching the current mission's is blocked.
You're suggesting that Osiris is here on Earth manipulating Dr. Jackson's dreams?

name: Proceeding with Caution
effect: This event costs power -1 to play for each Russian character who has a glyph. Each character gets skills +1 until the end of the current mission for each glyph he has.
Not a lot of trust and goodwill to spare right now I guess.

name: Prometheus, The X-303
effect: Each time you assign Prometheus you may pay 3 power. If you do ready a character who has a promotion token. Victory: Place a promotion token on a team character.
Sir we can't call it the Enterprise.

name: Protect Village
effect: Failure: Your opponent may search his deck for an obstacle card. If he does he reveals it takes it into hand and shuffles his deck.
Use Ancient technology to protect these villagers who have chosen not to worship the Ori from imminent attack.

name: Protector of All
effect: This event costs power -1 to play for each Asgard character who has a glyph. Destroy an obstacle.
Thor sends his thanks. I'm to tell you he's a member of a species who have visited your world often. They are a friend to all protector of all except the Goa'uld with whom they are at war.

name: Quantum Mirror Control
effect: Pay 3 power stop this gear -- Search your deck for a character card and reveal it. Then shuffle the rest of your deck and place that card on top of it.
This device found with the quantum mirror on P3R-233 allows the user to select the alternate reality to which the mirror is connected.

name: Quarantine Container
effect: Stop this gear . Choose an obstacle. When it would be destroyed place it face up beneath this gear instead. Your opponent discards any other card beneath this gear. Your opponent can't play an obstacle that has the same title as a card beneath this gear.
Effective against a variety of hazards.

name: Quartus, Chief Negotiation Officer
effect: Quartus' difficulty is equal to the experience of the current mission.
Operative of the Federal Security Council on P4M-328 brought in to deal with SG-1 when they were mistaken for rebel terrorists. He was an unyielding and difficult negotiator.

name: Ra's Mothership, Vessel of the Sun God
effect: Each time you assign Ra's Mothership you may pay 3 power. If you do place an assigned support character face down beneath it. Victory: The current mission gets difficulty +1 for each card beneath Ra's Mothership.
With this mighty warship the Goa'uld Ra enslaved the people of countless worlds.

name: Reanimated Dead
effect: This obstacle costs power -X to play where X is equal to the experience of the current mission. Failure: Destroy a support character.
The Ancient healing device discovered by Telchak was so potent it could even revive the dead as brutal zombie-like killers.

name: Recover Team Member
effect: When you play this mission choose a team character. He is blocked. Failure: Incapacitate the chosen character.
Rescue a prisoner being held at Baal's stronghold.

name: Recover Touchstone
effect: Success: Look at the top four cards of your deck. You may place them in any order on the top and/or bottom of that deck.
Track down an important and powerful artifact stolen from the people of this world.

name: Relentless Pursuit
effect: When you play this obstacle ready a villain ship.
...eventually the Odyssey's gonna come up against more than she can handle.

name: Repair Engines
effect: Success: Ready a hero ship.
Break free from this phenomenon by isolating its effect on your ship's engines.

name: Repel Moloc
effect: Success: Assigned adversaries can't be revived.
Carry out a counterattack against the Goa'uld that has located this newly established base of the Hak'tyl resistance.

name: Replicator Lander, Vanguard
effect: Replicator Lander gets firepower +1 for each other Replicator card at the current mission. Each time you assign Replicator Lander you may pay X power. If you do take a Replicator card that costs X from your discard pile into hand.
This craft disengages from a mothership to transport Replicators to a planet surface.

name: Replicator Mothership, Symbol of Change
effect: While Replicator Mothership is assigned each Replicator adversary gets difficulty +1. Victory: You may pay 1 power. If you do each Replicator obstacle at the current mission gets difficulty +1.
Most of the Replicators' ships are taken from other species but when Fifth took control of them original designs began to appear.

name: Replicator Ruse
effect: Failure: Look at one card from the top of your opponent's mission pile for each other Replicator card at the current mission. Place those cards in any order on the top and/or bottom of that pile.
Humans can be unpredictable. Particularly when they're desperate.

name: Rerouted
effect: Failure: Look at a number of cards from the top of your opponent's mission pile equal to the experience of the current mission. Place those cards on the top and/or bottom of that pile.
To protect Merlin's location Morgan le Fay programmed a device to automatically dial the Stargate at regular intervals and beam him through to sanctuary on a new planet.

name: Restore Timeline
effect: Success: You may take a hero card from your discard pile into hand.
Travel to the past and undo changes to history that have resulted in an alternate reality.

name: Retain Custody
effect: This mission gets difficulty +1 for each ready adversary.
Fend off attempts by other System Lords to force you to relinquish the recently captured Apophis.

name: Reverse Space/Time Rupture
effect: Success: Ready all assigned support characters.
Seal a bridge between parallel universes that is allowing multiple alternate versions of SG-1 to appear in our own universe.

name: Review Hollywood Script
effect: Each time an adversary or character would be destroyed by an opponent's card stop him instead.
An excellent cover for the real thing in the event of a security leak. --Hank Landry

name: Revisionist History
effect: To play this event stop an assigned character. Choose up to four non-event cards in a player's discard pile. That player shuffles them into his deck.
You weren't there!

name: Robert Kinsey, Goa'uld Infiltrator
effect: Each time you revive Robert Kinsey you may take a Goa'uld or Political obstacle at the current mission into hand.

Kinsey and key members of the Trust were secretly taken as hosts by System Lords desperate to resist Baal. They plotted to foment political discord on Earth and bring about a nuclear annihilation leaving them free to seize the Ancient weapon in Antartica.

name: Rodney McKay, Munitions Yield Expert
effect: Each time you assign Rodney McKay you may destroy all complications.
Years after Dr. McKay's first rocky but productive collaborations with Samantha Carter SG-1 traveled to Atlantis and enlisted his help in redirecting an Ori supergate.

name: Ronan, Betrayer
effect: Failure: Destroy a support character whose cost is equal to or less than the experience of the current mission.
Posing as a supporter of the Jaffa rebellion this young warrior waited for the right opportunity to strike a blow for the one true god Anubis.

name: Russian Controlled DHD
effect: Stop this gear stop a Russian team character or two Russian support characters -- Search your mission pile for a mission shuffle the rest of the pile then place that mission on top of it.

Germany secretly discovered the DHD meant to accompany the Giza Stargate. Russia seized it after World War II ultimately starting their own Gate program and on one occasion loaning it to the U.S.... for a price.

name: Ryk'l, Freedom Fighter
effect: Success: You may destroy Ryk'l. If you do destroy an assigned adversary.
Jaffa rebel working against the Goa'uld Moloc. He made contact with Teal'c to try and secure aid from Earth in his struggle.

name: Sabotage Ship Construction
effect: Failure: Your opponent may search his deck for a villain ship card. If he does he reveals it takes it into hand and shuffles his deck.
Stop worshipers of the Ori from completing construction on a fleet of mighty warships.

name: Salvage Enemy Ship
effect: Success: You may search your deck for a hero ship card. If you do reveal it take it into hand and shuffle your deck.
Take control of a Goa'uld derelict and begin studies of the technology that could be adapted for your own ships.

name: Samantha Carter, Formidable Warrior
effect: [L] and [L] : Obstacles cost power +1 to play. [O] and [O] : Obstacles cost power +1 to play. [P] and [P] : Obstacles cost power +1 to play.
Though usually called upon for scientific solutions to problems Samantha Carter is more than capable in an armed conflict.

name: Scramble
effect: Ready a hero ship.
We'll see if we can do some damage in close.

name: Se'tak, Leader of the Jaffa
effect: Destroy another support character -- Se'tak gets skills +1 until the end of the current mission. You can do this only once each turn.
Ambitious Jaffa who took leadership of the Jaffa High Council after Gerak. He was extremely suspicious of humans and withdrew from many existing agreements his predecessors had made with Earth.

name: Seberus, Racing Ship
effect: Each time you assign Seberus you may pay 3 power. If you do ready a support character.
With his determination and resourcefulness the Serrakin pilot Warrick modified this prison transport to race in the Loop of Kon Garat.

name: Secure Crash Site
effect: Each time you assign a character your opponent gains power equal to the number of glyphs he has.
Keep the public from learning of the site outside Colorado Springs where Baal's ship was shot down.

name: Sel'mak's Tel'tak, Scout
effect: While Selmak's Tel'tak is assigned each character who has a promotion token gets skills +1. Success: Place a promotion token on an assigned team character.
Small transport used by Selmak and his host Jacob Carter on stealth missions.

name: Senseless Slaughter
effect: Failure: You may pay any amount of power. Your opponent destroys that many support characters.
A treacherous Jaffa bombed a peaceful summit to eliminate opposition to the Ori. Many innocent bystanders were also killed.

name: Sergei Evanov, Team Leader
effect: Each time Sergei Evanov earns a different glyph you may search your deck for a Russian card. If you do reveal it take it into hand and shuffle your deck.
Leader of an all-Russian team operating out of the SGC. He is highly critical of the many mistakes made by his American counterparts preferring to work with his own countrymen."

name: Set Up
effect: Each time your opponent assigns a character who has no glyph you gain 1 power.

The greater the intensity of our weapons fire the greater and more frequent their expansion phases. There is a direct correlation. They're using the energy of our own weapons to build their beachhead.

name: Sha're, Beloved Wife and Daughter
effect: When you play Sha're the current mission gets: "Success: Gain 2 power."
Native of Abydos and daughter of Kasuf. She was key in helping the first team from Earth make the return trip. Daniel Jackson remained behind to be with her and the two eventually married.

name: Simon Coombs, Scientist in the Field
effect: Each time Simon Coombs earns a glyph place a promotion token on a team character.
Yale math professor who works with Jay Felger on a variety of secret projects at Stargate Command. He's an avid Star Trek fan who worships at the altar of Roddenberry.

name: Spies Everywhere
effect: This obstacle gets difficulty +1 for each card in your villain score pile.
The Goa'uld tend to struggle for supremacy even among one another. However a particularly powerful System Lord can rally the support of others which are often deployed as spies to undermine an enemy.

name: Super Pheromones
effect: When you play this obstacle choose a character. He is blocked.

According to the stories this woman had magical powers over men. She was supposed to be able to seduce them into doing anything for her. In almost every case it describes them as 'drunk with her presence.'

name: Ta'Seem, Tok'ra Surgeon
effect: When you play Ta'Seem you may destroy a stopped adversary.
Skilled surgeon who was brought in to attempt the removal of one of Baal's cloned symbiotes and then reimplant the host with a Tok'ra.

name: Tass'an, Settler
effect: Tass'an gets ING +1 while an adversary is assigned. Tass'an gets ING +1 while assigned with another Jaffa character.
Resistance fighter who after the fall of the Goa'uld helped found a Free Jaffa settlement on the planet Sartorus.

name: Teachings of Origin
effect: When you play this obstacle you may discard an Ori card. You gain power equal to its cost.

So it came to pass that Ver Omesh was gripped by a great famine. So Markon went to the Prophet Articus and asked to go to the forest for food. The prophet bade him be patient for the Ori provide for all who have faith.

name: Teal'c, Man of Action
effect: [P] and PT]: Each time you play a CUL mission you may ready Teal'c. [T] and [T]: Each time you play a COM mission you may ready Teal'c. [G] and [G]: Each time you play a ING mission you may ready Teal'c.
Please remain calm as we attempt to rectify this most unfortunate circumstance.

name: Technology Interface
effect: This obstacle's difficulty is equal to the experience of the current mission.
SG teams must often find ways to make devices from different worlds work with equipment from Earth and with each other.

name: Ted, Alien Deserter
effect: While Ted is ready SCI missions get difficulty +1.

Alien soldier who deserted from military service to hide on Earth. He maintains covert surveillance on fellow defector Martin Lloyd watching for any signs that his group's true non-human identities have been discovered.

name: Teeming Numbers
effect: When you play this obstacle destroy an assigned hero ship whose cost is equal to or less than the number of other Replicator cards at the current mission.
It's been what? Ten eleven hours since we picked up the cargo ship? The Replicators have had more than enough time to reach unmanageably large numbers.

name: Temptation
effect: Stop an adversary. Your opponent may stop a character.
I could make you more powerful than you could imagine. The powers you have seen in Wodan and the others... only a fraction of what I could give you.

name: Terra-Root
effect: Destroy this gear -- Gain 1 power.
Among the many scientific discoveries of the criminal Linea was a blend of chemical activators that when poured on Hadante's terra-root generates power through organically-based cold fusion.

name: The Daniel Jackson, Supreme Commander's Ship
effect: Each time you assign the Daniel Jackson you may pay 3 power. If you do take a hero card from your discard pile into hand.
The Asgard stepped up ship production after their losses in the fight against the Replicators. This vessel became Thor's new command ship and was named for a prominent human ally.

name: The Doci, Voice of the Ori
effect: Failure: Incapacitate a team character for each complication.
The power and the greatness of the Ori cannot be denied. Those who reject the path to enlightenment must be destroyed.

name: The Game of Diplomacy
effect: When you play this obstacle choose a glyph. Stop each character who has that glyph.
We can't give up on them yet. We still have the potential to save thousands of lives here.

name: The O'Neill, Last Great Hope
effect: Each time you assign the O'Neill you may destroy it. If you do destroy a Replicator obstacle at the current mission. Victory: You may pay X power. If you do destroy an obstacle that costs X.
A pinnacle of Asgard technological achievement this ship was specifically designed to fight against the Replicators.

name: Thor, Supreme Commander
effect: [P] or [T] : Each assigned team character gets +1 while Thor is assigned. [P] and [S] : Each assigned team character gets SCI +1 while Thor is assigned.
SG-1 under the command of General Hammond has saved my people and yours on many occasions. We are not only allies against the Goa'uld we are true friends.

name: Thoran, Tok'ra Intermediary
effect: Success: You may take a hero card from your discard pile into hand.
Tok'ra leader who had dealings with Earth on a few occasions though each was marked with some tension. He was much more at ease among his own people.

name: Threat of Force
effect: This obstacle costs power -1 to play for each card in your villain score pile.
Our sensors detect your shields at minimum. If you do not capitulate immediately we will open fire.

name: Tok'ra Tel'tak
effect: Success: Look at the top card of your mission pile. Place it on the top or bottom of that pile.

With limited resources available to them the Tok'ra have only a small number of ships at their disposal. None are capable of standing toe-to-toe with a Goa'uld Ha'tak. They instead deploy their scout ships on precise covert missions to further their cause.

name: Tomin, Strong, Proud Warrior
effect: Tomin gets difficulty +1 for each assigned character who doesn't have a glyph.
Husband of Vala Mal Doran. When a Prior healed him of a crippling infirmity he'd possessed since childhood he became a high-ranking soldier in the army of the Ori.

name: Too Easy
effect: Failure: Your opponent stops a number of characters equal to the experience of the current mission.
Security measures tend to scale in sophistication with the value of that being protected.

name: Trade Rendezvous
effect: Success: You may play a gear at no cost.
Come to an arrangement with a less than reputable trader.

name: Transdimensional Bridge
effect: When you play this obstacle you may choose to have your opponent shuffle his mission pile.
Simultaneous experiments being conducted by the Samantha Carters of two parallel universes caused an accident that drew one Carter into the other's reality.

name: Trial by Fire
effect: When you play this obstacle your opponent chooses an assigned team character. He is stopped. Failure: Incapacitate the chosen character.
And the people shall deliver unto you the wicked for your divine judgment where their sins shall be weighed in the balance of all that is just and true.

name: Trust-Controlled Al'kesh, Commandeered Vehicle
effect: Victory: You may pay 4 power. If you do destroy an assigned adversary.
Operatives of the Trust located the cloaked ship abandoned in orbit by Osiris when he was removed from his human host. From it they began launching biochemical attacks on enemies of Earth.

name: U.A.V.
effect: Stop this gear pay 1 power -- Reveal a random card from your opponent's hand. If it's a villain card the current mission gets difficulty -1.
The "Unmanned Airborne Vehicle which can be piloted remotely from the SGC control room conducts aerial surveys of the terrain around a destination Stargate.

name: Ultimatum
effect: Failure: You may pay 2 power. If you do incapacitate a team character.
I grow tired of this. Surrender now or your friends will be killed one by one.

name: Vala Mal Doran, Practiced Thief
effect: Each time Vala Mal Doran earns a glyph your opponent discards a random card. You gain power equal to its cost.

Though Vala had lived her life without settling down physically or emotionally the arrival of the Orici changed her outlook. She soon threw in with the SGC to try to keep her daughter from laying waste to the galaxy.

name: Vala Mal Doran, SG- Member
effect: Each other SGC team character gets skills +1 while Vala Mal Doran is assigned to a mission that has a glyph matching one of hers.

Trust agent who supervised a scan of Vala's mind sifting through memories for specific information from her time as the Goa'uld Qetesh. He derived some enjoyment from the pain the procedure inflicted.

name: Vengeful Prior, Hand of the Ori
effect: Ori obstacles cost power -1 to play while Vengeful Prior is assigned. Disease obstacles cost power -1 to play while Vengeful Prior is assigned.
As a reward for faithful service this former administrator of Ver Ager was transformed into a Prior. He quickly became one of the most ruthless and unyielding of the Ori's agents.

name: Weaver, Trust Interrogator
effect: At the start of your debrief phase you may discard up to one card for each different glyph Weaver has.
The first commander assigned to the Prometheus. He runs a tight ship with regular drills to test his crew's preparedness.

name: William Ronson, Prometheus Commander
effect: While a hero ship is assigned each other character who has at least one glyph matching one of William Ronson's gets skills +1.
How am I supposed to do a movie without any actors?

name: Withstand Armada
effect: This mission gets difficulty -1 while a hero ship is assigned.
Stand fast against the fleet of Anubis until the Ancient subterranean weapon can be activated to defend Earth.
